hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition Mean Reversion in Oversold Large Caps
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a BEAR to NEUTRAL regime transition, large-cap crypto assets (BTC, ETH, SOL) that are >1.5 standard deviations below their 30-day rolling mean (price vs. mean) will mean-revert by at least 8% more than those within 1 standard deviation, over the next 3 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BEAR regimes drive panic selling and dislocation from fundamentals. A shift to NEUTRAL reduces selling pressure, allowing the most oversold assets to snap back as tactical buyers and covering shorts enter.
entry_conditions: Regime transitions from BEAR to NEUTRAL
Asset's price is >1.5 std dev below its 30-day rolling mean
Enter long at market open following regime confirmation

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3 days after entry OR price reaches 30-day mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops further to >2 std dev below mean OR regime reverts to BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Oversold basket median return ≤ non-oversold basket return +2% over 3 days.
